title: Tank Rehabilitation
description: METHUEN, MA - FOREST STREET TANK REHABILITATION City of Methuen, MA (Owner) will receive sealed Bids for Forest Street Tank Rehabilitation, until 10:00 a.m. local time on June 15, 2022 at Office of the City Clerk, Methuen City Hall, 41 Pleasant Street, Room 112, Methuen, MA 01844. Bids received will then be publicly opened at the City Hall Third Floor Great Hall and read aloud. Bid security in the amount of 5 percent of the Bid must accompany the Bid. This Project includes abrasive blasting & recoating 3,800,000 gallon water tank, mods/repairs to existing steel tank structure, lead abatement, drain line installation, sample line relocation, new electrical shed & equipment relocation, Site Work, paving, fence mods. Substantial completion: 270 calendar days from start. Final completion: 300 calendar days from start. The Project being bid is subject to Massachusetts General Laws, Chapter 30, Section 39M and prevailing wage rates as issued by the Director of the Executive Office of Labor and Workforce Development, Department of Labor Standards under the provisions of Massachusetts General Laws, Chapter 149, Sections 26 to 27D inclusive, as amended, apply to this Project. A pre-Bid conference will not be held. Bidding Documents may be examined on or after 10:00 a.m. local time on May 25, 2022 at the Owner's offices, Procurement Office, Methuen City Hall, 41 Pleasant Street, Room 311, Methuen MA, 01844. Obtain electronic Bidding Documents (no cost): on or after 10:00 a.m. local time on May 25, 2022. Register by email with dandrews@woodardcurran.com with subject line Methuen MA - Forest Street Tank Rehabilitation. Instructions will be emailed. Solicitation Description:
CITY OF SCHERTZ

INVITATION FOR PROPOSALS

corbett ground storage tank project

# BID 2022-004


The City of Schertz is issuing a Request for Proposal for construction services of the CORBETT GROUND STORAGE TANK PROJECT, #BID 2022-004.



Sealed Proposals in response to this RFP addressed to the Purchasing and Asset Management Department will be received at 1400 Schertz Parkway Building # 2, Schertz, Texas 78154 no later than 3:00 PM (CST) on June 2, 2022, via hand delivery or mail. **No fax of E-mail bids will be accepted.** Sealed proposals must be submitted with one (1) electronic (USB Preferred) and one (1) original copy clearly marked in a sealed envelope as CORBETT GROUND STORAGE TANK PROJECT, #BID 2022-004. All Requests for Proposals must be in the City of Schertzs possession on or before the scheduled date and time (no late RFP will be accepted).



RFQ documents can be obtained from the Citys website at http://www.schertz.com/bids.aspx. Be advised that if your company downloaded the documents from the web page and is contemplating responding to this RFP, you should register as a Schertz Vendor at www.publicpurchase.com so any changes/additions via addenda can be accessed by your company. Any questions in reference to these Proposals may be directed to Purchasing & Asset Management at (210) 619-1160 or purchasing@schertz.com.



A Pre-Submittal conference will be held on May 2, 2022 at 11:00 A.M. (CST) in the City of Schertz Bob Andrews Conference Room at 1400 Schertz Parkway, Building #1, Schertz, Texas 78154. Questions are due in writing no later than May 9, 2022, at 12:00 P.M. (CST).



The City of Schertz reserves the right to refuse and reject any or all responses, waive any or all formalities or technicalities, accept the response or portions of the response determined to be the best value and most advantageous to the City, and hold the responses for a period of 120 days without taking action. The City of Schertz reserves the right to accept responses from more than one firm determined to be the best option for the City. Respondents are required to hold their responses firm for the same period of time.

category_id: Consulting: Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Bids
title: ADA Transition Plan Update
description:
The Town of Cary is seeking one or more qualified firm(s) with which to contract for the following services:
Accessibility codes have continued to evolve since the adoption of the ADA in 1990. In 2015, Cary hired an accessibility consultant to audit over (70) seventy buildings, parks, and greenways and create an ADA Transition Plan to guide effports in removing identified accessible barriers. Since completion of the ADA Transition Plan in 2016, Cary has spent over $1.5M in design and construction renovations to remove the identified barriers from many of these facilities. At this time, staff would like to update the ADA Transition Plan to continue Carys efforts to remove all accessible barriers from all of our facilities.

The purpose of this invitation to tender (ITT) is to establish a panel of qualified trainers/tutors from which individuals/companies will be selected to participate in a mini competition for contract award for delivery of MODULE 2 - BUSINESS SUPPORTS FOR THE MAYO FOOD & DRINK SECTOR for the Mayo Food & Drink Training Programme as identified to businesses and social/community enterprises in Mayo.  
Training may be delivered remotely or on-site, to groups of up to 12 participants or to individual businesses. The detailed instructions regarding the format and requirements of the ITT are set out below. These instructions must be observed to ensure the completeness and eligibility of the tender.  
This panel will remain open until December 2022 but SWMDC reserve the right to extend the panel for a further 2 x 12 months subject to the availability of funding.

The proposed Mayo Food & Drink Networking and Training Programme (MFDNTP) will ensure stimulation and activation of networking opportunities, tailored training needs and skills development as outlined in the Mayo Food and Drink Strategy 2025.
The Mayo Food & Drink Training Programme aims to:
??	Assist in the recovery of Mayo food businesses in the aftermath of the Covid19 pandemic. 
??	Offer food businesses access to training as identified in the Mayo Food & Drink Strategy needs analysis. The Training Programme will focus on:
??	Addressing the digital deficit
??	eCommerce routes to markets
??	Opportunities for integration of food sectors with tourism sectors.
??	Sustainability ?? LEAN, waste reduction and product/service development
??	Delivering food supports to develop greener business practices

title: KAFB Official Mail Center And Postal Service Center Services
description: THIS IS A SOURCES SOUGHT NOTICE. NO SOLICITATION IS AVAILABLE AT THIS TIME. This is not a Request for Proposal (RFP), Request for Quotation (RFQ), or an Invitation for Bid (IFB). This notice is not to be construed as a commitment, implied or otherwise by the Government, to issue a solicitation or ultimately award a contract. The purpose of this Sources Sought Notice is to identify potential sources capable of performing the effort described herein pursuant to FAR part 10, Market Research and FAR part 19, Small Business Programs. This is for planning purposes only. Any information submitted by respondents to this Sources Sought is voluntary. The Air Force does not intend to award a contract on the basis of this notice or to otherwise pay for the information solicited. Respondents should not construe this notice as a commitment by the Air Force for any purpose, and should refrain from providing proprietary information in the response. 1. INTRODUCTION: This is the initial step in the planning process for Official Mail Center (OMC) And Postal Service Center (PSC) Services at 377TH Force Support Squadron (FSS). The 377 MSG/PKA at Kirtland Air Force Base seeks sources to provide high level support to the Force Support Squadron by providing Official Mail Center (OMC) And Postal Service Center (PSC) Services to the FSS. ? 377 MSG/PKA anticipates conducting a competitive acquisition for this effort. The effort is expected to result in a Firm-Fixed-Price contract. NAICS code is anticipated to be 491110, size standard $8.0 million. 2. INSTRUCTIONS: All businesses capable of providing OMC and PS support in accordance with the attached draft PWS are invited to respond electronically. Responses shall include company name, address, DUNS number, CAGE code, point of contact with email address and telephone number, and ?indicate business size (small business, small disadvantaged business, service-disabled veteran-owned small business, economically disadvantaged woman-owned small business, woman-owned small business, or HUBZone) using NAICS 49110, size standard 8.0 million dollars. The Air Force reserves the right to consider a small business socioeconomic set-aside for any subsequent acquisition based upon responses to this notice. Small business respondents should provide a statement of capabilities to assist the Air Force in making a set-aside decision. Capabilities should include reponses , Services: Printing

category_id: Services: Printing, Publishing, Mailing, Subscription, Books and Periodical Bids
title: Publication of the City of Irvine Legal Notices in a Regional Newspaper
description:
CITY OF IRVINE, CALIFORNIA
NOTICE INVITING BIDS SUMMARY
Bid No. 22-3252

DESCRIPTION OF WORK: The work to be performed shall include, but not be limited to:
Publication of the City of Irvine Legal Notices in a Regional Newspaper of General Circulation in the County of Orange, including the City of Irvine, during Fiscal Year 2022-23. Requirements include:

Vendor must be adjudicated in Orange County

Legal notices must:

Circulate/publish in Orange County, including the City of Irvine

Publish in English

Publish at least seven (7) days per week

DATE OF OPENING BIDS: Bid prices must be entered on the BidsOnline system in accordance with the instructions no later than June 10, 2022, at 10:00 a.m., at which time bids will be publicly opened and read aloud via online meeting tool. LATE BIDS WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED. NO OTHER METHOD OF BID SUBMITTAL WILL BE ACCEPTED.

The City reserves the right, after opening bids, to reject any or all bids, to waive any informality in a bid, to make awards in the interest of the City, and to reject all other bids.

OBTAINING BID: To obtain a copy of the bid documents, please visit the City of Irvine web site at www.cityofirvine.org/purchasing. Click on the "Supplier Registration and Bid Opportunities" link, and review the information about our online system. Next, click on the "BidsOnline" link. If you are not currently registered with the City of Irvine, please click on the "New Vendor Registration" button and then complete the electronic supplier registration. After registering your firm, click on the "Bid Opportunities" button to view and download the Bid Documents, which include the complete Notice Inviting Bids document. Contractors must register on the City's web site and download the Bid Documents in order to submit a bid. Firms must also check the web site periodically for addenda information as failure to download any and all addenda and acknowledge receipt within the site will result in bid disqualification.

CITY OF IRVINE

By: /s/ Carl Petersen
Carl Petersen, MPA, CMC
City Clerk

agency: Department of Health and Human Services
description: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the procedures contained in FAR Part 12.6, Acquisition of Commercial Items, and FAR Part 13, Simplified Acquisition Procedures, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; quotes are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. This acquisition is for the selected contractor to provide drug database licensing. (A) The solicitation number is 75N97022Q00034 and is issued as a Request for Quotation (RFQ). (B) The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular (FAC) Number 2022-05. (C) The associated NAICS code is 511199 and the size standard in number of employees is 500. (D) List CLINS, item descriptions, quantities and units of measure: See attached RFQ. (E) Description/Statement of Work/Specification: See attached RFQ. (F) FAR Provision 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors-Commercial, is incorporated by reference and applies to this acquisition. Please see the attached RFQ terms and conditions for the submission requirements. (G) FAR Provision 52.212-2, Evaluation Commercial Products and Commercial Services, is incorporated by reference and applies to this acquisition. For the evaluation criteria, please see the attached RFQ terms and conditions. (H) Offerors are required to complete in full FAR Provision 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications-Commercial Items, with their offer online at SAM: www.sam.gov. An offeror must state in their offer if they completed FAR 52.212-3 online and that is it up-to-date and valid. See the attached RFQ terms and conditions for more requirements. (I) FAR Clause 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions-Commercial Items, applies to this acquisition. Please see the attached RFQ terms and conditions for its Addendum. (J) FAR Clause 52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Required to Implement Statutes or Executive Orders-Commercial Items, is incorporated and applies to this acquisition. Please see the attached RFQ terms and conditions that are applicable to the acquisition. (K) A statement regarding any additional contract requirement(s) or terms and conditions (such as contract financing arrangements or warranty requirements) determined by the contracting officer to be necessary for this acquisition and consistent with customary commercial practices: N/A. (L) Date, time and place offers are due.?Offers are due by June 7th, 2022 at 11:00 AM EST.? Submit offers to the following e-mail address(es), by the offer due date and time: Cameron Earle Cameron.earle@nih.gov and Karen Miller Karen.miller@nih.gov.

The City of Blue Springs, Missouri requests proposals for professional printing services for the on-call printing and mailing distribution (when applicable) of various printed materials as outlined in this Request for Proposals upon request and as needed by the City. category_id: Services: Transport, Logistics, Hauling, Shipping, Warehousing, Moving Bids
title: Lituya Crew Transport
description:
ITB#2522S072 Lituya Crew Transport
The Department of Transportation and Public Facilities, Alaska Marine Highway System (AMHS) is soliciting bids to result in a multi-year contract with a qualified contractor to provide private water taxi or passenger charter boat service from a place on the Ketchikan road system to the Annette Bay Ferry Terminal on Annette Island. The awarded contractor will be required to transport five (5) AMHS employee crew members to and from the M/V Lituya docked at the AMHS Annette Bay Ferry Terminal Thursday through Monday twice a day. The morning route will depart at approximately 7:45AM. For the evening route, the AMHS crew members will need to be picked up at 5:15PM and returned to the Ketchikan road system where they departed from in the morning.

Copies of bid documents may be downloaded (Adobe Acrobat format) from this Online Public Notice website. If you download the solicitation, you must register with the Procurement Officer listed below to receive subsequent amendments. Failure to contact the Procurement Officer may result in the rejection of your offer.

Copies of the bid documents are also available upon request from the Procurement Officer.

Cherish Petrenchak

Voice: (907)465-8447

Fax: (907) 465-3124

Email: cherish.petrenchak@alaska.gov

category_id: Services: Transport, Logistics, Hauling, Shipping, Warehousing, Moving Bids
title: V112--Laundry Trucking Service Phoenix VA
description: THIS IS A SOURCES SOUGHT NOTICE (SSN) ISSUED SOLELY FOR INFORMATION AND PLANNING PURPOSES ONLY AND DOES NOT CONSTITUTE A SOLICITATION. DISCLAIMER This SSN is issued solely for information and planning purposes only and does not constitute a solicitation. All information received in response to this SSN that is marked as proprietary will be handled accordingly. IAW FAR 15.201(e), responses to this notice are not offers and cannot be accepted by the Government to form a binding contract. Responders are solely responsible for all expenses associated with responding to this SSN. SOURCES SOUGHT DESCRIPTION The purpose of this notice is to gain knowledge of potential qualified sources and their size classification relative to the North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code 484110 General Freight Trucking, Local. The small business size standard is $30.0M. Responses to this notice will be used by the Government to make appropriate acquisition decisions. After review of the responses to this notice, a solicitation announcement may be published. Responses to this notice are not considered adequate responses for a solicitation announcement. The Department of Veterans Affairs (VA), VISN 22 Network Contracting Office 22, is seeking capable sources that are classified and registered inwww.vip.vetbiz.govas either Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Businesses (SDVOSB) or Veteran-Owned Small Businesses (VOSB) that can provide transportation for supplies and laundry delivery services of clean and soiled linen items to/from the Phoenix Veterans Administration Health Care System (PVAHCS), Laundry Plant, Phoenix, AZ. and the Northern Arizona Veterans Administration Health Care System (NAVAHCS), Prescott AZ. and back again and surrounding Community Based Outpatient Clinics (CBOC s). The anticipated period of performance is a 12-months Base Period and four 12-months Option Periods. The information identified above is intended to be descriptive, not restrictive and to indicate the quality of the supplies/services that will be satisfactory. It is the responsibility of the interested source to demonstrate to the government that the interested parties can provide the supplies/services that fulfill the required specifications. Other interested and capable businesses of providing the services described in this notice, shall provide the information indicated below. Response to this notice should include business name, address, point of contact, size of business pursuant to the following questions: Identification of business size status, Cage Code, and SAM ID. Please indicate the size standard and representation of your business, such as but not limited to: Service-Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB), Veteran Owned Small Business (VOSB), Hubzone, Woman Owned Small Business (WOSB), Large Business, etc.). Indication of which NAICS code(s) your business usually performs under Government contracts. Proof of experience and capability to provide the service indicated on this notice. If you intend to sub-contract any work, what portion of the total cost will be self-performed/will be performed by your organization? Please provide estimated detailed percentage breakdowns related to sub-contracted work and completion of job. Does your business have an FSS contract with GSA or the VA or are you a contract holder with NASA SEWP or any other federal contract? If so, please provide the contract number. If you are an FSS GSA/VA or NASA SEWP contract holder or other federal contract holder, are the services you are providing information for available on your schedule/contract? General pricing of your service is encouraged. Pricing will be used for the purpose of market research only. It will not be used to evaluate for any type of award. Please review the attached Performance Work Statement (PWS) and provide feedback or suggestions. If none, please reply as N/A. Responses to this notice shall be submitted via email to Ms. Tammy Perrine, Contracting Specialist, tammy.perrine@va.gov. Telephone responses will not be accepted. Responses must be received no later than 4:00 p.m. AZ time on 6 June 2022. If a solicitation is issued it shall be announced at a later date, and all interested parties must respond to that solicitation announcement separately from the responses to this notice. Responses to this notice are not a request to be added to a prospective bidders list or to receive a copy of the solicitation.

title: RFP for As-Needed Moving Services
description:
The City of San Diego (City) is committed to providing its departments with moving services using professional, efficient, and experienced movers. The successful proposer (Contractor) shall provide office relocation and moving services on an as needed basis. Services may include, but are not limited to, moving free standing furniture, records and City-owned equipment throughout various locations in the City of San Diego. Services may consist of moving one or more individual offices and/or department from one physical location to another within the City. The Contractor shall also pick-up and deliver City-owned surplus property to the City's contracted auctioneer provided on an as-needed basis.

Taylor Cox 619-236-6044
CoxTJ@sandiego.gov

title: Bids for Drayage Services
description: The County of Los Angeles (County) Department of Treasurer and Tax Collector (TTC) is issuing this Invitation for Bids (IFB) for the provision of Drayage Services. You may download the IFB from the Internet by accessing the Countys website at https://camisvr.co.la.ca.us/lacobids/, selecting Open Solicitations, and then searching by the solicitation title of Drayage Services. You may also download the IFB by accessing the TTCs website at https://ttc.lacounty.gov/contract-opportunities. Potential Bidders are responsible for downloading and reviewing the entire IFB. The IFB contains the service requirements, bid content and format requirements, a description of the bid selection process, and a sample contract. Potential Bidders that meet the minimum requirements identified in Subparagraph 1.4, Bidders Minimum Mandatory Qualifications, are invited to submit a bid to provide the services described in Appendix B, Statement of Work. Potential Bidders should carefully review the IFB and ensure their bid complies with all IFB requirements. A virtual Mandatory Bidders Conference (Conference) to answer questions regarding the written specifications of the IFB will be held at 11:00 a.m. Pacific Time (PT) on Thursday, June 2, 2022. Bidders that intend to submit bids must attend this conference or will be disqualified. To register to attend the Conference, please send an email to Ashley Cupino, Contracts Section, at contracts@ttc.lacounty.gov no later than 5:00 p.m. PT on Tuesday, May 31, 2022. Bids must be prepared in accordance with Subparagraph 2.9, Bid Submission, of the IFB. Bidders understand and agree that submission of a bid constitutes acknowledgement and acceptance of, and a willingness to comply with, all terms and conditions of this IFB and any IFB addenda including, but not limited to, Appendix B, Statement of Work. The terms and conditions of the Sample Contract are not negotiable. Bids are due no later than 5:00 p.m. PT on Tuesday, June 21, 2022, and shall be submitted in accordance with Subparagraph 2.9 to: contracts@ttc.lacounty.gov. Bids received after the scheduled deadline will not be accepted and shall be returned to the sender unopened.

description:
A. Teichert & Son, Inc. dba Teichert Construc


An Equal Opportunity Employer,


is requesting quotations from all qualified


WBE,MBE


sub-contractors and material suppliers for the following project:



2021 Greenback Lane Complete Streets Improvements Project



City/Location: Citrus Heights, CA


County: Sacramento



Owner: City of Citrus Heights



Bid Date: Tuesday 12/20/2022 at 3:00 PM



We are requesting bids for the following trades and/or supplies:


Teichert Construction is requesting quotes from all qualified subcontractors and suppliers including certified MBE/WBE firms for the following items of work, including but not limited to: all materials, labor and equipment for CONSTRUCTION AREA SIGNS, TRAFFIC CONTROL SYSTEM, RESET, ADJUST ROADWAY ITEMS, PLANE ASPHALT CONCRETE, CLEARING & GRUBBING, EROSION CONTROL, AGGREGATE BASE, ASPHALT CONCRETE, PAVING ASPHALT (ASPHALT CONCRETE), PAVEMENT REINFORCING FABRIC, RECYCLE, RECLAIM ASPHALT CONCRETE, MINOR CONCRETE STRUCTURE, ALTERNATIVE PIPE CULVERT, REINFORCED CONCRETE PIPE, PLASTIC PIPE, CONCRETE CURB & SIDEWALK- MISC, SURVEY OR HISTORICAL MONUMENT, THERMOPLASTIC TRAFFIC STRIPING & MARKING, LAND SURVEYING, CUTTING, SAFETY EQUIPMENT SUPPLIER, PETROLEUM, OIL, LUBRICANTS SUPPLIER (BULK ITEM), ASPHALT SUPPLIER(BULK ITEM), PIPE SUPPLIER, DRAINAGE SYSTEMS SUPPLIER, STORM WATER SYSTEMS SUPPLIER, PAVEMENT MARKERS SUPPLIER, ELECTRICAL & SIGNALS SUPPLIER, TRAFFIC STRIPES, MARKING AND TRAFFIC CONTROL MATERIALS SUPPLIER, MATERIAL TESTING SERVICES, LAND SURVEYOR, LEAD COMPLIANCE, SWPPP PLANNING, BOTTOM DUMP TRUCK, TRANSFER DUMP TRUCK, SUPER 10 DUMP TRUCK, WATER TRUCK, END DUMP TRUCK, STREET SWEEPING TRUCK and TRUCKER BROKER.



NAICS Classifications
Sector 23--Construction
All Other Specialty Trade Contractors
Other Heavy and Civil Engineering Construction



CSI Classifications
DIVISION 1 - GENERAL
TRUCKING-HEAVY HAULING
TRUCKS -- DUMP/TRAILERS
DIVISION 2 - SITE WORK
CONCRETE CURBS/GUTTERS
CONCRETE PIPE
PAVING/SURFACING
SIGNAGE
TRAFFIC SIGNALS



Bid documents can be viewed at or obtained from:


Docs & Plans Available from https://www.citrusheightsplanroom.com/



Request for qualified bids from Subcontractors, Suppliers & Truckers for the following project:
Project: 2021 Greenback Lane Complete Streets Improvements Project ? City of Citrus Heights 

Docs & Plans Available from https://www.citrusheightsplanroom.com/
Estimate: $2,400,000 Duration: 90 working days Agency Goals: 16.1% MBE and 6.9% WBE 
Teichert Construction intends to work cooperatively with all qualified firms seeking work on this project, including but not limited to breaking out contract work items into economically feasible units to increase overall MBE/WBE participation. Plans and specifications are available from the municipality listed above and the Teichert?s Roseville Estimating office. For assistance obtaining or regarding the plans and specifications, please contact the listed Estimator.

100% Payment and Performance Bonds for subcontractors are required. Teichert will pay bond premium up to 2%. Insurance Waiver of subrogation also required. However, certified MBE/WBE's are encouraged to contact Teichert and request assistance if they are unable to meet Teichert's standard bonding or insurance requirements. MBE/WBE's also are encouraged to contact Teichert for assistance in obtaining lines of credit, equipment, supplies, materials or related assistance or services. Subcontractor, Supplier and Trucker quotes must be valid, at minimum, for the award period stated in the contract documents. Please note that this is a prevailing wage project and Teichert Construction is Union signatory. Subcontractors will be subject to the terms and conditions of Teichert's subcontract and safety documents available at www.teichert.com/for-subcontractors.cfm. Submission of a bid to Teichert will confirm that you have reviewed and accepted Teichert's subcontract form. Conditions or exceptions in Subcontractor?s quote are expressly rejected unless accepted in writing prior to bid. Subcontractor scopes and supplier quotes are required 24 hours prior to bid. Additional information and or assistance to MBE/WBE's available from: *** All Subcontractor Quotes must have the Department of Industrial Relations # to be ACCEPTED ***




A. Teichert & Son, Inc. dba Teichert Construc


400 Sunrise Avenue, Suite 300


Roseville, CA 95661


Phone: (916) 757-6400  Fax: (916) 757-6499


John Gale


estimating@teichert.com

title: Grade A 40' Storage Containers
description: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; quotes are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. This solicitation is issued as a Request for Quotation (RFQ). The solicitation and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2021-05. The U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC) intends to procure 2 grade A 40' standard height storage containers, painted white with lock boxes installed. The 40' standard height storage containers must be provided on a Firm-Fixed basis. The provision at 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors-Commercial Items (Nov 2021), applies to this acquisition. In addition to the requirements of FAR 52.212-1, the quote must prominently display the offeror's Taxpayer Identification number, CAGE code and DUNS number, as well as contact information for the offeror's point of contact for the quote. A valid SAM.gov registration is required for award.? The clause at 52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions-Commercial Items (Nov 2021), applies to this acquisition. Please see attachment for the remaining clauses and provisions. Evaluation of quotes will be on a lowest priced technically acceptable basis. Technical acceptability will be determined by quoting all required items at a fair and reasonable price. Questions on this requirement are due no later than May 27, 2022 at 12:00pm Eastern. Quotes are due via email to DBraswell@cpsc.gov no later than June 6, 2022 at 12:00pm Eastern. ?

category_id: Services: Transport, Logistics, Hauling, Shipping, Warehousing, Moving Bids
title: Government Owned Contractor Operated Alongside Aircraft Refueling Services
description: ****AMENDMENT 0006 is hereby issued to EXTEND the solicitation DUE TO A CHANGE WITHIN THE REQUIREMENT.? PLEASE ENSURE YOU READ AND LOOK AT ALL UPDATES AND CHANGES!!!!? Attached you will find the Amendment, an? updated Solicitation and Performance Work Statement which provides all CHANGES. ********? *Amendment 0005 is hereby issued to EXTEND the solicitation close date and to provide a solicitation update that incorporates three new clauses. *Amendment 0004 is hereby issued to EXTEND the solicitation close date.?? *Amendment 0003 is hereby issued to provide a clean copy of the Performance Work Statement. *Amendment 0002 is hereby issued to provide an updated Past Performance Questionnaire (PPQ) with the correct name in the RETURN INFORMATION SECTION of the document. *Amendment 0001 is hereby provided to update section L-0002 L198 PREPROPOSAL CONFERENCE (SERVICES) (DLA ENERGY JUL 2018) of the solicitation, and to inform offerors of change in date for when all questions are due for submittal. Solicitation close date is extended to April 25, 2022.* *Please read entire modification.? In reference to the attendance to the conference ensure that you submit your information by the date stated.? Thanks!* Defense Logistics Agency - Energy is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for Alongside Aircraft Refueling Services to include managing, maintaining, and operating Government Owned Fuel Service Facilities and equipment at the Government Owned, Contractor-Operated (GOCO) facilities at Naval Air Station Patuxent River (NAS Patuxent River), MD. Services include providing all technical support, personnel, supervision, equipment, tools, materials, and other items as required by the Performance Work Statement (PWS) on behalf of DLA Energy, in support of the Department of Navy. The vendor will be responsible to furnish, manage, maintain, and operate mobile fuel servicing equipment required to support the facilities, equipment, vehicles, and aircraft assigned to and as may transit, deploy to, or exercise at this location. The vendor will also be responsible to provide, maintain, and operate Contractor-Furnished Vehicles in support of aircraft and vehicles assigned or transient to NAS Patuxent River. DLA Energy will follow source selection procedures utilizing the Lowest Price Technically Acceptable (LPTA) evaluation process in accordance with FAR 15.101-2 for this acquisition. The requirement is a four-year base performance period from Jan 1, 2023 - Dec 31, 2026; five-year option period from Jan 1, 2027 - Dec 31, 2031, and option to extend the contract for a total of no more than six months (anticipated Jan 1, 2032 - Jun 30, 2032). Solicitation number will be SPE603-22-R-0504. The pre-proposal conference location and date is to be determined. Notice of this conference will be posted via Amendment at a later date.? This acquisition will be Full and Open Competition (unrestricted). DLA Energy will award one Firm-Fixed Price contract. Contract awarded will be subject to FAR 52.222-41, Service Contract Act of 1965. The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Code is 493190, and the size standard is $30 million.All responsible offerors may submit an offer for consideration. If an entity was previously registered in CRR the information should have transferred into SAM. You just need to set up a SAM account and migrate your CCR roles. 2. description: ****AMENDMENT 0006 is hereby issued to EXTEND the solicitation DUE TO A CHANGE WITHIN THE REQUIREMENT.? PLEASE ENSURE YOU READ AND LOOK AT ALL UPDATES AND CHANGES!!!!? Attached you will find the Amendment, an? updated Solicitation and Performance Work Statement which provides all CHANGES. ********? *Amendment 0005 is hereby issued to EXTEND the solicitation close date and to provide a solicitation update that incorporates three new clauses. *Amendment 0004 is hereby issued to EXTEND the solicitation close date.?? *Amendment 0003 is hereby issued to provide a clean copy of the Performance Work Statement. *Amendment 0002 is hereby issued to provide an updated Past Performance Questionnaire (PPQ) with the correct name in the RETURN INFORMATION SECTION of the document. *Amendment 0001 is hereby provided to update section L-0002 L198 PREPROPOSAL CONFERENCE (SERVICES) (DLA ENERGY JUL 2018) of the solicitation, and to inform offerors of change in date for when all questions are due for submittal. Solicitation close date is extended to April 25, 2022.* *Please read entire modification.? In reference to the attendance to the conference ensure that you submit your information by the date stated.? Thanks!* Defense Logistics Agency - Energy is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for Alongside Aircraft Refueling Services to include managing, maintaining, and operating Government Owned Fuel Service Facilities and equipment at the Government Owned, Contractor-Operated (GOCO) facilities at Naval Air Station Patuxent River (NAS Patuxent River), MD. Services include providing all technical support, personnel, supervision, equipment, tools, materials, and other items as required by the Performance Work Statement (PWS) on behalf of DLA Energy, in support of the Department of Navy. The vendor will be responsible to furnish, manage, maintain, and operate mobile fuel servicing equipment required to support the facilities, equipment, vehicles, and aircraft assigned to and as may transit, deploy to, or exercise at this location. The vendor will also be responsible to provide, maintain, and operate Contractor-Furnished Vehicles in support of aircraft and vehicles assigned or transient to NAS Patuxent River. DLA Energy will follow source selection procedures utilizing the Lowest Price Technically Acceptable (LPTA) evaluation process in accordance with FAR 15.101-2 for this acquisition. The requirement is a four-year base performance period from Jan 1, 2023 - Dec 31, 2026; five-year option period from Jan 1, 2027 - Dec 31, 2031, and option to extend the contract for a total of no more than six months (anticipated Jan 1, 2032 - Jun 30, 2032). Solicitation number will be SPE603-22-R-0504. The pre-proposal conference location and date is to be determined. Notice of this conference will be posted via Amendment at a later date.? This acquisition will be Full and Open Competition (unrestricted). DLA Energy will award one Firm-Fixed Price contract. Contract awarded will be subject to FAR 52.222-41, Service Contract Act of 1965. The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Code is 493190, and the size standard is $30 million.All responsible offerors may submit an offer for consideration. category_id: Infrastructure: Patching, Milling, Seal Coat, Asphalt Repair Bids
title: Bids for Maintenance for the East Bay Greenway
buyer: Alameda County Congestion Management Agency, California
agency: Alameda County Congestion Management Agency, California
description:
Maintenance for the East Bay Greenway Between the Coliseum BART Station and 85th Ave (Segment 7A) (R22-0012)

The Alameda County Transportation Commission (Alameda CTC) proposes seeking bids from contractors to maintain the East Bay Greenway (Segment 7A) along San Leandro Street between the Coliseum BART Station and 85th Avenue (Project). The Project includes sweeping, weed removal, graffiti removal, striping, pothole filling, painting of fences/railing, repair/replacement of railing and other items as described in the contract documents. A California Class A contractors license is required.
This contract will be funded with Measure B funds. As such, the Alameda CTC Local Business Contract Equity Program (LBCE) will apply. The LBCE Programs goals for construction are 60.0% for Local Business Enterprise (LBE) and 20.0% for Small Local Business Enterprise (SLBE). This contract is not subject to the Disadvantaged Business Enterprise Program.

description:
Bid Number: 	SRWWTP 2022-002
Bid Title: 	Facility Asphalt Repair & Overlay Project
Category: 	Snake River WWTP
Status: 	Open

Description:

Summit County Snake River WWTP

Request for Proposals

Facility Asphalt Repair & Overlay Project



The Snake River Wastewater Treatment Plant, an Enterprise Fund of Summit County Government, is currently soliciting proposals to provide its treatment facility driveway and parking lot areas with asphalt repair and overlay of approximately 90,000 square feet.   A full Request for Proposals and description of the work to be provided can be obtained at www.co.summit.co.us/Bids.aspx. Submit questions regarding the proposals to  josh.johnson@summitcountyco.gov.



All bids must be titled 2022 Asphalt Repair & Overlay Proposal and shall be electronically submitted to josh.johnson@summitcountyco.gov and kirsten.norman@summitcountyco.gov or by a sealed, hardcopy delivery mailed to the attention of Josh Johnson at: Snake River WWTP 4344 Swan Mountain Road Dillon, CO 80435 by 2:00 pm Thursday June 23, 2022.  Proposals received after 2:00pm, will NOT be accepted.  



At said time and place, all accepted proposals that have been duly received will be publicly opened and read aloud. The Contract will be awarded to the lowest responsible bidder who best meets the requirements of Summit County and the public interest.



Summit County Board of County Commissioners reserves the right to reject any or all proposals, to waive irregularities or informalities, and to conduct such investigations or negotiations as it deems necessary to select the most responsible and responsive proposal.
Publication Date/Time:
5/20/2022 6:00 AM
Closing Date/Time:
6/23/2022 2:00 PM

title: Street Cut Repair Program
description:
Street Cut Repair Program

The work to be done under this contract consists of furnishing all labor, materials, and equipment necessary to remove and replace existing pavements on streets, sidewalks, driveways, and the like in the City of Carbondale. All work shall be in accordance with the contract documents, plans, specifications, and as directed by the Engineer or his representative.

Bids will be received until 10:00 a.m., Thursday, June 9, 2022, by mail or delivered by hand to the Finance Department Purchasing Office, City of Carbondale, 200 South Illinois Avenue, Carbondale, Illinois, immediately after which time and at such place all bids will be publicly opened and read aloud.

The Project is also subject to the State of Illinois Job Works Jobs Program Act and the Illinois Works Apprentice Initiative.

Contractor shall not pay less than the prevailing rates of wages to all laborers, workmen, and mechanics performing work under this contract, and shall comply with the requirements of the Illinois Wages of Employees on Public Works Act (820ILCS 130/1-12).

No bid shall be withdrawn for a period of forty-five (45) days subsequent to the opening of bids without consent of the City of Carbondale.

The Contract shall be awarded to the lowest responsible bidder complying with the provisions of this Invitation for Bids. The owner reserves the right to reject any or all proposals and to waive any informality or technicality in any proposal in the interest of the City.

category_id: Infrastructure: Patching, Milling, Seal Coat, Asphalt Repair Bids
title: Road Milling and Resurfacing
description:
OWNER - The Town of Medaryville acting through its Board, hereby gives notice that sealed bids will be received at the Medaryville Town Hall for the following described project.

PROJECT This project generally consists of the milling and resurfacing of the road surface of Main, Boston, West Maple and West Streets in the Town of Medaryville, Pulaski County Indiana.

Bids will be received on the following contract(s):

M0068-05-22-00111.00 - Contract A - Main, Boston, West Maple, & West Street Pavement Improvements

TIME Sealed bids will be received until 11:00 AM local time, on Wednesday, June 8, 2022 in the Medaryville Town Hall, 409 E. Main, Medaryville, IN 47957. Bids will be opened at this time.

BIDS All bids shall be addressed to Town of Medaryville, 409 E. Main Street, Medaryville, IN 47957.

Bids shall be sealed and shall have the name and address of the bidder and the contract for which the bid is being submitted on the outside of the envelope. All bidders shall bid in accordance with and upon the Bid Forms included in the contract documents.

EXAMINATION OF CONTRACT DOCUMENTS The contract documents are on file for inspection at the office of McMAHON Associates, Inc., 952 S. State Road 2, Valparaiso, IN 46385.

PROCUREMENT OF CONTRACT DOCUMENTS Copies of the contract documents may be obtained from McMAHON Associates, Inc., 952 S. State Road 2, Valparaiso, Indiana 46385, phone number: 219-462-7743, email: bkwolf@mcmgrp-in.com.

A non-refundable processing charge of $50.00 will be required for each set of contract documents. The fee applies whether digital or paper documents are obtained, or if the plans and picked up or shipped to Contractor.

BID SECURITY No bid shall be received unless accompanied by a certified check or satisfactory bid bond payable to Town of Medaryville in the in an amount not less than 5% of the maximum bid as a guarantee that, if the bid is accepted, the bidder will execute and file the contract, performance/payment bonds and insurance certification, as required by the contract documents, within ten (10) days after the Notice of Award.

BID REJECTION The OWNER reserves the right to reject any and all bids, waive any informalities in bidding or to accept the bid or bids which best serves the interests of the Town of Medaryville.

WITHDRAWAL OF BIDS No bid shall be withdrawn for a period of 60-days after the scheduled opening without the consent of the OWNER.

GOVERNING LAWS & REGULATIONS The contract letting shall be subject to and governed by the laws of the State of Indiana.

Published by the authority of the Town of Medaryville acting through its Board.

Ms. Stacy Conley, Clerk-Treasurer

title: Transport of Recycled Glass
description:
REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL
RFP22-60R
RFP Name: Transport of Recycled Glass

Only one of the following submission methods is required:

Sealed proposals in one (1) clearly labeled unbound original, and three (3) paper copies, and one (1) electronic version on a USB flash drive or CD, will be received at the Office of the Chief Purchasing Officer, Procurement Division - 101 CAMINO ENTRADA, BUILDING 3, Los Alamos, NM 87544, until 2:00 p.m. Mountain Time, June 7, 2022 for this solicitation.

Considering the current COVID-19 (corona virus) outbreak, until further notice, the following procedure is in effect: Proposals may also be submitted electronically by email in pdf format. title: Local Area Set-Aside (FAR 26.2): Office Furniture Move - Austin Texas FEMA TRO
description: The Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) Region 6 Texas Recovery Office in Austin, Texas is relocating its office within the vicinity of? its current office in Austin, TX (within 15 miles of current location) and requires the service of office furniture movers to palletize, load, transport and unload office furniture and items.?Some items require minor assembly at destination such as desks.? Some items are prepalletized and some require palletization.? Details are in the Statement of Work (SOW).? The Item List attached to the SOW indicates if items require assembly and/or require palletization.? Pictures of most, but not all of the items are also included with the SOW.?? FEMA is requesting a quotation from local area vendors to provide furniture moving service who reside or primarily do business in the Presidentially Declared Disaster Area of DR-4332-TX Hurricane Harvey. The declared disaster counties are listed in the solicitation.?? Site Visit:? November 10, 2021 11:00 a.m. Central Time RSVP to Patricia.Gilmore@fema.dhs.gov - All pariticipants must comply with EO 14042 Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors - A list of attendee full names shall be provided 72 hours in advance.? Questions due by November 15, 2021 3:00 p.m. Central Time.? All questions shall be?submitted in email, no phone calls please. Patricia.Gilmore@fema.dhs.gov; sandra.shanks@fema.dhs.gov? Quotations due: November 19, 2021 3:00?p.m. Central Time.? Email quotations to Sandra.Shanks@fema.dhs.gov; Patricia.Gilmore@fema.dhs.gov? ?

category_id: Services: Transport, Logistics, Hauling, Shipping, Warehousing, Moving Bids
title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): Miller's Flat Gravel Haul-Manti-LaSal National Forest
description: The Manti-LaSal National Forest anticipates a need for loading and hauling of up to 20,000 CY of stockpiled aggregate on the Millers Flat Road 50014 The project consists of: This contract is for the loading and hauling of up to 20,000 CY of stockpiled aggregate on to the Millers flat road 50014. The material for the northern portion of the road, from Highway 31 to the intersection of 53306 at the Scad Valley Divide, will come from the Cabin Hollow Pit. The material for the southern portion of the road, From the intersection of 53306 at Scad Valley Divide to the intersection with 50217 Potters Canyon, will come from the Reederview Pit. This contract also includes options. Option 1:? The loading and hauling of up to 3,200 CY of stockpiled aggregate on to the main roads in the Lake Fork Canyon Campground. This includes roads Lake Canyon 50359, Lake Canyon South Access 53132, Lake Canyon CG New Loop 53133, Lake Canyon Rolfson South 53050 and Lake Canyon Rolfson North 53051 from the Cabin Hollow Pit. Option 2:? The loading and hauling of up to 1,500 CY of stockpiled aggregate on to the Potters Canyon Road 50271 and the South Loop of Potters Campground 52217 from the Reederview Pit. Option 3:? The loading and hauling of up to 6,000 CY of stockpiled aggregate on to the South Skyline Drive Road from Highway 31 to the end of the gravel, approximately 7 miles. Option 4:? The loading and hauling of up to 3,000 CY of stockpiled aggregate onto North Skyline from Highway 31 to the pit location. This will occur at locations if they begin to show excess wear from hauling operations. Option 5:? The loading and hauling of up to 3,000 CY of stockpiled aggregate onto the South end of Millers Flat from the pit location to the intersection with Potters Canyon 50271. This will occur at locations if they begin to show excess wear from hauling operations. The contract includes loading stockpiled aggregate into hauling vehicles and dumping onto roadway to be spread and placed by the forest service. Minimum of 6 hauling trucks will be required at all times during hauling days. Hauling days will be Monday ? Friday 8am ? 5pm, except on Holiday Weekends. The project location is: The Cabin Hollow Pit is located approximately 15 miles northeast of Fairview, Utah. You can access the Cabin Hollow Pit from Fairview by traveling east on Highway 31 up Fairview Canyon to the intersection with Forest road 50150 Skyline drive, then North approximately 5 miles on 50150 Skyline Drive to the pit. The Reederview Pit is located approximately 17 miles northwest of Orangeville, Utah. You can access the Reeder View Pit from Orangeville by traveling west on Highway 29 up Straight Canyon to the intersection with Forest road 50014 Miller Flat Rd, then North approximately 0.7 miles on 50014 Miller Flat Rd to the pit. The Millers Flat road 50014 is located approximately 19 miles northeast of Fairview, Utah, traveling east on Highway 31. This road is the main location for the delivery of the aggregate. From this intersection the project extends south along the Millers Flat road approximately 11 miles. Options 1, 2 & 5 are accessed from this section of roadway. The South Skyline Road 50150 is located approximately 14 miles northeast of Fairview, Utah, traveling east on Highway 31. From this intersection this option of the project extends south along the South Skyline road approximately 7 miles. Questions regarding this opportunity are due in writing to the CO, Chris Hansen, christine.m.hansen@usda.gov? by Tuesday, May 31, 2022 at 1:00 PM Mountain Time (local time). Project start date will be approximately May 1, 2023 This project is a total Small Business Set Aside. All future information about this acquisition, including amendments, will be distributed solely through this site. Interested parties are responsible for monitoring this site to ensure that they have the most up-to-date information about this acquisition. SAM REGISTRATION REQUIREMENTS: Prospective contractors must be registered in the System for Award Management (SAM) prior to submitting a proposal www.sam.gov.

title: Government Owned Contractor Operated Alongside Aircraft Refueling Services
description: Amendment 0002-Preproposal Conference Sign-In Sheets and Preproposal Conference Presentations Dated: May 25, 2022 Amendment 0001- Updated PWS Dated: May 5, 2022 Defense Logistics Agency - Energy is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for Alongside Aircraft Refueling Services to include managing, maintaining, and operating Government Owned Fuel Service Facilities and equipment at the Government Owned, Contractor-Operated (GOCO) facilities at Naval Air Station Souda Bay (NAS Souda Bay), Greece. ?Services include providing all technical support, personnel, supervision, equipment, tools, materials, and other items as required by the Performance Work Statement (PWS) on behalf of DLA Energy, in support of the Department of Navy. The vendor will be responsible to furnish, manage, maintain, and operate mobile fuel servicing equipment required to support the facilities, equipment, vehicles, and aircraft assigned to and as may transit, deploy to, or exercise at this location. The vendor will also be responsible to provide, maintain, and operate Contractor-Furnished Vehicles in support of aircraft and vehicles assigned or transient to NAS Souda Bay, Greece. DLA Energy will follow source selection procedures utilizing the Lowest Price Technically Acceptable (LPTA) evaluation process in accordance with FAR 15.101-2 for this acquisition. The requirement is a four-year base performance period from Dec 1, 2023 - Nov 30, 2027; five-year option period from Dec 1, 2027 - Nov 30, 2032, and option to extend the contract for a total of no more than six months (anticipated Dec 1, 2032 - May 31, 2033). Solicitation number will be SPE603-22-R-0506. The pre-proposal conference will be held on Wednesday, May 18, 2022 commencing at 8:30 AM at: Naval Support Activity Souda Bay Greece Visitor Control Center (VCC) Mouzouras Rd., BLDG 85 American Base Chania, Crete, Greece 73100 All attendees must provide by email to the Contract Specialist, Wing Yi Wong, at wing.wong@dla.mil, on or before 3p.m. (US Eastern Time), April 28, 2022, the name(s) and company represented, of the individual(s) who plan to attend. In addition, foreign nationals must provide a copy of their passport ID (including the bio-data page) and a copy of company travel order. U.S. citizens must provide a copy of their U.S. passport (including the bio-data page) and a copy of company travel order. U.S. DOD Civilians and contractors must provide a copy of their DOD ID (front and back) and a copy of company travel order. *For Foreign Nationals, the processing time will take up to 3 weeks. This acquisition will be Full and Open Competition (unrestricted). DLA Energy will award one Firm-Fixed Price contract. Contract awarded will be subject to FAR 52.222-41, Service Contract Act of 1965. The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Code is 493190, and the size standard is $30 million.? All responsible offerors may submit an offer for consideration. Secure Documents Several documents related to this solicitation will be posted as "secured" in the www.Sam.gov website. Please find below instructions to access secured documents in www.Sam.gov. Instructions for access to the www.Sam.gov Secure Site: To access the secured, but unclassified, documents in the SAM.gov ("www.Sam.gov ") system, offerors must: Several documents related to this solicitation will be posted as "secured" in the https://sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities). Please find below instructions to access secured documents in https:/sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities). Instructions for access to the https://sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities): To access the secured, but unclassified, documents in https://sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities), offerors must: 1. Be registered in the System for Award Management (SAM). Please note that SAM has replaced the previous system Central Contractor Registration (CCR). If an entity was previously registered in CRR the information should have transferred into SAM. You just need to set up a SAM account and migrate your CCR roles. 2. Once registered in SAM, go to website at https://sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities) and log in. Verify your registration within the SAM system. The https://beta.sam.gov/ learning guide is available at https://sam.gov/help/new-to-sam to provide assistance. NOTE:? PLEASE KEEP IN MIND ALL DATES ARE SUBJECT TO CHANGE!!!

category_id: Services: Transport, Logistics, Hauling, Shipping, Warehousing, Moving Bids
title: Sludge Hauling Services
description:
REBID IFB 2022-042 Sludge Hauling Services

Status: Open
RFP 2801-1

City of Lynchburg -Lynchburg, VA

 Any and all addenda will ONLY be posted on the City's website at: http://www.lynchburgva.gov/current-solicitations

The purpose of this IFB (Invitation to Bid) is to supply the needs of the WRRF for drivers and trucks to haul sludge, process residuals and perform other related driver functions around the facility. At the time of this bid, material is disposed of at two locations: the Region 2000 Landfill on Livestock Road (Route A and emergency Route B) and the Maplewood Landfill in Amelia (Route C). The Plants materials must be hauled on the routes attached (Attachment A- Route Maps A-C) which are approved by the DEQ (Department of Environmental Quality). Use of any other routes unless routes are approved/established detours by Virginia Department of Transportation (VDOT), Virginia State Police (VSP) or other official state agency, are not allowed. Process residuals must be removed from the plant on a regular schedule.

title: Government Owned Contractor Operated Alongside Aircraft Refueling Services
description: Amendment 0001- Updated PWS Dated: May 5, 2022 Defense Logistics Agency - Energy is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for Alongside Aircraft Refueling Services to include managing, maintaining, and operating Government Owned Fuel Service Facilities and equipment at the Government Owned, Contractor-Operated (GOCO) facilities at Naval Air Station Souda Bay (NAS Souda Bay), Greece. ?Services include providing all technical support, personnel, supervision, equipment, tools, materials, and other items as required by the Performance Work Statement (PWS) on behalf of DLA Energy, in support of the Department of Navy. The vendor will be responsible to furnish, manage, maintain, and operate mobile fuel servicing equipment required to support the facilities, equipment, vehicles, and aircraft assigned to and as may transit, deploy to, or exercise at this location. The vendor will also be responsible to provide, maintain, and operate Contractor-Furnished Vehicles in support of aircraft and vehicles assigned or transient to NAS Souda Bay, Greece. DLA Energy will follow source selection procedures utilizing the Lowest Price Technically Acceptable (LPTA) evaluation process in accordance with FAR 15.101-2 for this acquisition. The requirement is a four-year base performance period from Dec 1, 2023 - Nov 30, 2027; five-year option period from Dec 1, 2027 - Nov 30, 2032, and option to extend the contract for a total of no more than six months (anticipated Dec 1, 2032 - May 31, 2033). Solicitation number will be SPE603-22-R-0506. The pre-proposal conference will be held on Wednesday, May 18, 2022 commencing at 8:30 AM at: Naval Support Activity Souda Bay Greece Visitor Control Center (VCC) Mouzouras Rd., BLDG 85 American Base Chania, Crete, Greece 73100 All attendees must provide by email to the Contract Specialist, Wing Yi Wong, at wing.wong@dla.mil, on or before 3p.m. (US Eastern Time), April 28, 2022, the name(s) and company represented, of the individual(s) who plan to attend. In addition, foreign nationals must provide a copy of their passport ID (including the bio-data page) and a copy of company travel order. U.S. citizens must provide a copy of their U.S. passport (including the bio-data page) and a copy of company travel order. U.S. DOD Civilians and contractors must provide a copy of their DOD ID (front and back) and a copy of company travel order. *For Foreign Nationals, the processing time will take up to 3 weeks. This acquisition will be Full and Open Competition (unrestricted). DLA Energy will award one Firm-Fixed Price contract. Contract awarded will be subject to FAR 52.222-41, Service Contract Act of 1965. The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Code is 493190, and the size standard is $30 million.? All responsible offerors may submit an offer for consideration. Secure Documents Several documents related to this solicitation will be posted as "secured" in the www.Sam.gov website. Please find below instructions to access secured documents in www.Sam.gov. Instructions for access to the www.Sam.gov Secure Site: To access the secured, but unclassified, documents in the SAM.gov ("www.Sam.gov ") system, offerors must: Several documents related to this solicitation will be posted as "secured" in the https://sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities). Please find below instructions to access secured documents in https:/sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities). Instructions for access to the https://sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities): To access the secured, but unclassified, documents in https://sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities), offerors must: 1. Be registered in the System for Award Management (SAM). Please note that SAM has replaced the previous system Central Contractor Registration (CCR). If an entity was previously registered in CRR the information should have transferred into SAM. You just need to set up a SAM account and migrate your CCR roles. 2. Once registered in SAM, go to website at https://sam.gov/ (Contract Opportunities) and log in. Verify your registration within the SAM system. The https://beta.sam.gov/ learning guide is available at https://sam.gov/help/new-to-sam to provide assistance. NOTE:? PLEASE KEEP IN MIND ALL DATES ARE SUBJECT TO CHANGE!!!

In addition, foreign nationals must provide a copy of their passport ID (including the bio-data page) and a copy of company travel order. U.S. citizens must provide a copy of their U.S. passport (including the bio-data page) and a copy of company travel order. U.S. DOD Civilians and contractors must provide a copy of their DOD ID (front and back) and a copy of company travel order. *For Foreign Nationals, the processing time will take up to 3 weeks. This acquisition will be Full and Open Competition (unrestricted). DLA Energy will award one Firm-Fixed Price contract. category_id: Services: Transport, Logistics, Hauling, Shipping, Warehousing, Moving Bids
title: Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) Sole Source (FAR 19.14) Forklift Operator Support
description: THIS NOTICE OF INTENT IS NOT A REQUEST FOR QUOTES. A DETERMINATION NOT TO COMPETE THE PROPOSED PROCUREMENT BASED UPON RESPONSES TO THIS NOTICE IS SOLELY WITHIN THE DISCRETION OF THE GOVERNMENT. The Puget Sound Naval Shipyard and Intermediate Maintenance Facility (PSNS and IMF) Contracting Department (Code 400), hereby provides notice of its intent to award a sole-source, firm fixed service contract to SJS Executives, LLC, 2652 Excalibur Court, Virginia Beach VA 23454. The contract is expected to be awarded using FAR Part 13 procedures.? The period of performance shall be from 6 July 2022 to 16 September 2022. This requirement is to provide forklift operator support.? In accordance with 41 U.S.C. 1901 IAW FAR 13.5, and 15 U.S.C. 657(f) IAW FAR 19.1406. Authorized or Required by Statute, the Government is soliciting SJS Executives, LLC as ?a Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) sole source action.? The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for this work is 488320-? Marine Cargo Handling, with a Business Size Standard of $41,500,000.00.? The Product Service Code Class is V119- Transportation/Travel/Relocation- Transportation: Other THIS NOTICE OF INTENT IS NOT A REQUEST FOR COMPETITIVE QUOTES; no solicitation or RFQ will be forthcoming. However, interested parties may identify their interest and capability to respond to this requirement no later than June 03, 10:00am Pacific Standard Time. Interested parties are encouraged to furnish information by email only with subject line stating - RESPONSE TO INTENT TO SOLE SOURCE FOR N4523A22Q5703. A determination to compete this requirement, based upon responses to this notice, is solely within the discretion of the Government. Information received will normally be considered solely for the purpose of determining whether to conduct a competitive procurement. PSNS and IMF Contracting will NOT be responsible for any costs incurred by interested parties in responding to this notice of intent. Only written responses will be considered. All responses from responsible sources will be fully considered. As a result of analyzing responses to this notice of intent, the Government shall determine if a solicitation will be issued. Any prospective contractor must be registered in the System for Award Management (SAM) in order to be eligible for award. All documents submitted will not be returned. All interested parties shall submit clear and convincing documentation demonstrating their capabilities to satisfy the requirements listed above to Contract Specialist Carolyn Seim, by email at Carolym.m.seim1@navy.mil and Contracting Officer, George Rutt at George.rutt@navy.mil. The capability documentation should include general information and technical background describing in detail the prospective contractor's capabilities and experience that will demonstrate the ability to support these requirements.

The Agency requires managed services?including the secure storage, management, and distribution?of medical supplies and pharmaceuticals at Site E. Please see the attached documents for more details.

category_id: Services: Transport, Logistics, Hauling, Shipping, Warehousing, Moving Bids
title: Layberthing of 2 ?G? Class LMSR Vessels, GORDON and GILLILAND, on the East Coast of the United States
description: Bid opeinging will be on Monday June 27th at 2pm EST.? Please send bids to: Henry Puppe U.S. DOT/Maritime Administration, MAR-380 1200 New Jersey Avenue SE. Mail Stop W28-201 Washington, DC 20590 This will be a MS Teams Bid Opening: Microsoft Teams meeting call in (audio only) +1 509-931-1572,,514286227# ? United States, Spokane Phone Conference ID: 514 286 227# The Maritime Administration (MARAD) requires services for the exclusive long-term safe layberthing for two (2) Large Medium Speed Ro/Ro?s (LMSR) vessels, GORDON and GILLILAND on the U.S. East Coast.? Although the layberth is intended for the vessel identified in this solicitation, the Government may substitute a vessel of a similar size or smaller. A Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) between the Department of the Defense (DoD) and the Department of Transportation (DOT) establishes that, in consideration of the National Defense and the American Merchant Marine, a mutual interest and responsibility exists for the joint establishment, maintenance and control of a Ready Reserve Force (RRF), which is an element of the National Defense Reserve Fleet (NDRF).? The ships of the RRF are maintained by MARAD in various states of readiness to meet common user lift requirements of the armed services in a contingency.? The RRF consists of 41 vessels as of October 15, 2021.

category_id: Services: Transport, Logistics, Hauling, Shipping, Warehousing, Moving Bids
title: NATO International Competitive Bidding (ICB): Provision of Video Tele-Conferencing (VTC) Maintenance Support Services
description: The NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCI Agency) intends to issue an Invitation for Bid (IFB) for the provision of Video Tele-Conferencing (VTC) Maintenance Support Services. ? Potential U.S. prime contractors must 1) maintain a professionally active facility (office, factory, laboratory, etc.) within the United States, 2) be pre-approved for participation in NATO International Competitive Bidding (ICB), 3) hold a Facility Security Clearance at the level of SECRET or higher, and 3) be issued a Declaration of Eligibility (DOE) by the U.S. Government. ?? Execution of the proposed contract may require unescorted access and work of contractor personnel at NATO Class II security areas, and in accordance with NATO Security Policy, personnel of the winning bidder will be required to hold individual security clearances of COSMIC TOP SECRET. Only firms maintaining the appropriate personnel clearances will be able to perform the resulting contract. Personnel security clearances shall be valid at the time of contract signature. The contract award will not be delayed to allow contractor personnel to obtain missing clearances. The reference for the IFB is IFB-CO-115712-VTC and all correspondence concerning the IFB should reference this number. For source selection, the NCI Agency will use the Lowest Priced Technically Compliant Bid Evaluation methodology. It is planned to place a single Firm Fixed Price (FFP) contract for the entire scope of work. No partial bidding will be allowed. SUMMARY OF REQUIREMENTS Please see attached. These requirements are being refined and detailed as part of the preparation of the IFB. BECOMING ELIGIBLE TO BID NATO ICB requires that the U.S. Government issue a DOE for potential U.S. prime contractors interested in this project. Before the U.S. Government can do so, however, the U.S. Government must approve the U.S. firm for participation in NATO ICB. ?U.S. firms are approved for NATO ICB on a facility-by-facility basis.? The U.S. NATO ICB application is a one-time application. ?The application requires supporting documentation in the form of 1) a company resume or capability statement indicating contracts completed as a prime contractor and 2) an annual report or set of financial documents indicating compilation, review, or audit by an independent CPA. U.S. firms can download a copy of the U.S. NATO ICB application from the following website: http://www.bis.doc.gov/index.php/other-areas/strategic-industries-and-economic-security-sies/nato-related-business-opportunities ?? The Department of Commerce (DOC) is the U.S. Government agency that approves NATO ICB applications. Please submit to the email address provided your application and supporting documentation (as attachments). If your firm is interested in a specific NATO ICB project at this time, please also include the following in the text of your email: ? - the title and/or solicitation number of the project - the name/phone/email of the company employee who should receive the bid documents After approval of your one-time NATO ICB application, DOC will then know to follow up by issuing a DOE for the project. ?DOC will transmit the DOE to the NATO contracting agency. ? IMPORTANT DATES: Request a DOE (and, for firms new to NATO ICB, submit the completed one-time NATO ICB application): 24 June 2022 NCI Agency distributes the IFB (planned): end of July 2022 Details regarding a Bidder?s Conference, if applicable, will be included in the IFB document. Bid Closing (target): early September 2022 Contract Award (target): December 2022 Period of Performance: January 2023 to December 2025 + optional years

description: 05.24.2022 - Amendment 0002 to include Questions and Answers Letter and new proposal submission deadline 04.22.2022 - Offerors Shall review documents attached.? Solicitation No.19GE5022R0044 -Amendment 0001 - FAP Warehousing Services at the US Embassy Lima, Peru The Regional Procurement Support Office (RPSO) Frankfurt would like to invite your company to submit a proposal for Outsourced Warehousing Services for a Furniture and Appliance Pool (FAP) at the US Embassy Lima, Peru, as per attached solicitation documents. The complete proposal shall be submitted by e-mail with the subject line: "Proposal 19GE5022R0044? on or before May 26, 2022, 15:00 hours Central European Summer (CEST), to PerezAcevedoA@state.gov . No proposals will be accepted after the time indicated above. Please note: All communication and the award documents shall be in English. Please do NOT contact the US Embassy Lima directly regarding this project. Attachment 2 of the solicitation contains the Microsoft Excel spreadsheet for pricing you need to complete / submit.? You may choose the currency of your offer, but we would like to point out that your chosen currency cannot be changed at any later date. Please submit your proposal in accordance with the instructions set forth in Section 3 ? Instructions to Offerors (page 44) of the solicitation. An active SAM registration is a condition of award (See Section 2, FAR clause 52.212-4 (t)). Section 5 of the solicitation contains the representations and certifications you need to complete / submit Including Form W-14 (if required) Attachment 3 (Contract Information Sheet / Experience Listing) ? please use these formats to submit the requested information. Any questions regarding the subject solicitation may be directed to Ms. Alexandra Perez Acevedo? via e-mail PerezAcevedoA@state.gov no later than May 09, 2022 15:00 hours Central European Summer Time (CEST). ?Questions will be collected and, in the interest of fair contracting, the replies will be provided anonymously in form of a solicitation amendment.

title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): PROVIDE HUSBANDRY SERVICES TO THE NOAA SHIP OKEANOS EXPLORER AT SAINT THOMAS US VI
description: THIS IS A COMBINED SYNOPSIS/SOLICITATION FOR COMMERCIAL ITEMS PREPARED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE FORMAT IN FAR SUBPART 12.6, AS SUPPLEMENTED WITH ADDITIONAL INFORMATION INCLUDED IN THIS NOTICE. THIS ANNOUNCEMENT CONSTITUTES THE ONLY SOLICITATION; QUOTES ARE BEING REQUESTED AND A WRITTEN SOLICITATION WILL NOT BE ISSUED. THIS SYNOPSIS/SOLICITATION 1333MK22QNMAN0026 CONSTITUTES A REQUEST FOR QUOTATION (RFQ) AND INCORPORATES PROVISIONS AND CLAUSES IN EFFECT THROUGH FEDERAL ACQUISITION CIRCULAR 2022-06. THE NATIONAL OCEANIC ATMOSPHERIC ADMINISTRATION (NOAA), OFFICE OF MARINE & AVIATION OPERATIONS (OMAO), NOAA SHIP OKEANOS EXPLORER REQUIRES HUSBANDRY SERVICES SAINT THOMAS US. VIRGIN ISLANDS CLIN DESCRIPTION QUANTITY UNIT PRICE TOTAL PRICE 0001 PROVIDE AN ITEMIZED QUOTE FOR PORT TO THE NOAA SHIP OKEANOS EXPLORER AT SAINT THOMAS US. VIRGIN ISLANDS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ATTACHED STATEMENT OF WORK TO PAGES 5-7. SERVICES INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING: 1. PIER SPACE 2. LINE HANDLERS 3. SEWAGE OFFLOAD/BLACKWATER 4. DUMPSTER/ INTERNATIONAL GARBAGE 5. POTABLE WATER 6. MAIL SERVICES 7. FREIGHT SERVICES 8. HAZMAT HANDLING 9. CUSTOMS AND IMMIGRATION PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: (TOTAL OF 10 DAYS) BETWEEN: 01-31 AUG 2022 ANTICIPATED MOORAGE DATES: 18 ? 27 AUG 2022 0002. PROVIDE TRAINED AND QUALIFIED UNARMED SECURITY WATCH STANDERS TO MAINTAIN 24-HOUR SECURITY, 7-DAYS PER A WEEK, PROVIDING CONTINUOUS WATCH OVER THE GANGWAY OR GATE SECURITY IN APPROPRIATE SHIFTS. PLEASE REFER TO PAGE 7 OF THE SOW. 0003. HUSBANDING AGENCY FEES. FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION PLEASE REFER TO PAGE 7 OF THE SOW. ** THIS FEES ARE STRICTLY FOR THE ENTIRE PURCHASE ORDER AND WILL BE TRACKED UNDER THIS CLIN. ** AGENCY FEE SHALL NOT COLLECT ANY MARK UP, ADDITIONAL COMMISSIONS OR OTHER FEES ASSOCIATED WITH ANY OTHER CLINS. ** INCLUSION OF FAR CLAUSE 52.217-8, OPTION TO EXTEND SERVICES, IN THE SOLICITATION AND RESULTANT CONTRACT IS FOR USE BY THE GOVERNMENT AS OUTLINED AT FAR 37.111, EXTENSION OF SERVICES. THE OPTION WILL BE EXERCISED AS NEEDED AT ANY TIME DURING THE LIFE OF THE CONTRACT USING THE RATES APPLICABLE AT THE TIME OF EXERCISE. 0004 OPTIONAL SERVICES. REQUESTED OPTIONS SERVICES, IF AVAILABLE (SOME, ALL OR NONE OF THE EXAMPLE OPTIONS SERVICES ON PAGES 8 MAY BE AWARDED AT THE TIME OF THE AWARD, AND/OR THROUGHOUT THE LIFE OF THE CONTRACT. THESE OPTIONS MAY BE FUNDED UNDER MULTIPLE CLINS NOT JUST RESTRICTED TO CLIN 0004. FUNDS MAY BE ALLOCATED AS PLACE HOLDER AT THE AWARD LEVEL OR DURING THE LIFE OF THE CONTRACT FOR PROCUREMENT AND DELIVERY OF ADDITIONAL SERVICES AT MARKET PRICE OR NEGOTIATED RATE IF QUOTED. SERVICES MAY INCLUDE BUT NOT LIMITED TO: SECTION 1: ADDITIONAL SERVICES ON THE STATEMENT OF NEED FROM PAGE 5-7 SUCH EXAMPLES INCLUDES ADDITIONAL TRASH AND SEWAGE PICK UP, OR ADDITIONAL GUARD SERVICE/ WATCH STANDERS, ETC. SECTION 2: ANY SERVICE RELATED TO PORT SERVICES ON PAGE 8 OF THE SOW SUCH AS PILOTS, TUG SERVICES, SHORE POWER, FORKLIFT WITH LICENSE OPERATOR, SUPPORT PROCURRING FOOD STORE AND OR ANY ADDITIONAL SERVICE FOR ENTRY TO SAINT THOMAS US VI NOT ADDRESSED IN THE SOW. ?***PLEASE PROVIDE AN ITEMIZED QUOTE/ PRICE LIST FOR SECTION 2.*** THE GOVERNMENT WILL AWARD A FIRM FIXED PRICE CONTRACT BASED ON BEST VALUE TO THE GOVERNMENT: EXPERIENCE/ PAST PERFORMANCE, AVAILABILITY (SERVICES AND DATES), AND PRICE. OPTION CLIN WILL ALSO BE EVALUATED BASED ON THE OVERALL AVAILABILITY AND BEST PRICE. THIS ACQUISITION IS 100% SMALL BUSINESS SET ASIDE UNDER NAICS CODE 488310, PORT AND HARBOR OPERATIONS WITH SIZE STANDARD OF $41.5 MIL, THE PRODUCT SERVICE CODE IS V119. PLEASE REVIEW THE ATTACHED RFQ 1333MK22QNMAN0026 AND PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION WITH THE OFFER: ?RFQ NUMBER, INCLUDING NAME, ADDRESS, TELEPHONE NUMBER AND DUNS NUMBER, CAGE CODE AND TAX ID. PLEASE PROVIDE A DETAILED AND ITEMIZED COST TO INCLUDE THE TOTAL AMOUNT PER STATEMENT OF REQUIREMENTS AND PER LINE ITEMS. INCLUDE STATEMENT SPECIFYING THE EXTENT OF AGREEMENT WITH ALL THE TERMS, CONDITIONS, AND PROVISION INCLUDED IN THIS RFQ. QUOTES THAT REJECT THE GOVERNMENT TERMS AND CONDITIONS ON THIS SOLICITATION MAY BE EXCLUDED FROM CONSIDERATION. ACKNOWLEDGEMENT OF SOLICITATION AMENDMENTS (SF-30) IF ANY. PLEASE PROVIDE AT LEAST THREE REFERENCES FOR JOBS PERFORMED WITHIN THE PAST THREE YEARS THAT ARE THE SAME OR SIMILAR IN IN SCOPE SPECIFICALLY IN "VESSEL HUSBANDRY SERVICES".VENDOR SHALL PROVIDE A POINT OF CONTACT THAT INCLUDES NAME, TELEPHONE NUMBER, EMAILS AND A DETAIL DESCRIPTION OF THE SERVICE PERFORMED AND PRICE. ALL RESPONSIBLE SOURCES MAY SUBMIT A QUOTATION WHICH SHALL BE CONSIDERED BYTHE AGENCY. QUOTES MUST BE SUBMITTED VIA ELECTRONIC MEANS (EMAIL) NO LATER THAN JUNE 06, 2022, AT 5:00 P.M. EASTERN TIME (ET). TO ALEXANDER.CANCELA@NOAA.GOV. THE GOVERNMENT DOES NOT ACCEPT RESPONSIBILITY FOR NONRECEIPT OF EMAIL. IT IS THE CONTRACTOR'S RESPONSIBILITY TO REQUEST A CONFIRMATION OF THE EMAIL RECEIPT. ALL QUESTIONS MUST BE SUBMITTED IN WRITING TO ALEXANDER.CANCELA@NOAA.GOV? NO LATER THAN BY MAY 31, 2022, AT 5:00 P.M ET. TELEPHONE INQUIRIES WILL NOT BE HONORED. CONTRACTORS ARE ENCOURAGED TO REGISTER WITH THE FEDBIZOPPS VENDOR NOTIFICATION SERVICE AS WELL AS THE INTERESTED VENDORS LIST FOR THIS ACQUISITION (SEE APPLICABLE TAB WITHIN FEDBIZOPPS WHERE THIS SYNOPSIS/ SOLICITATION IS POSTED). QUOTERS MUST BE REGISTERED IN THE SAM DATABASE TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS AWARD. REGISTRATION IS FREE AND CAN BE COMPLETED ON-LINE AT HTTP:// WWW.SAM.GOV/. FOR CLAUSES AND PROVISION PLEASE SEE ATTACHED STANDARD FORM1449 1333MK22QNMAN0026.
